xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas
Class MemoryManageableSA<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.AbstractSweepArea<E>
      xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.DecoratorSweepArea<E>
          xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.MemoryManageableSA<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SweepArea<E>, MemoryManageable, MemoryMonitorable, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultMemoryManageableSA
public abstract class MemoryManageableSA<E>
extends DecoratorSweepArea<E>
implements MemoryManageable

This abstract class decorates a SweepArea to make it memory manageable. Implementors of subclasses have to specify how to handle an overflow.

Constructor Detail

MemoryManageableSA

public MemoryManageableSA(SweepArea<E> sa,
                          int objectSize,
                          int memSize)
Creates a memory manageable SweepArea by decorating the underlying SweepArea.

Parameters:
sa - The underlying SweepArea
objectSize - The size of the objects in this SweepArea (in bytes).
memSize - The preferred amount of memory (in bytes).

getAssignedMemSize

public int getAssignedMemSize()
Returns the amount of memory which is assigned to this SweepArea.

Specified by:
getAssignedMemSize in interface MemoryManageable
Returns:
Returns the assigned amount of memory (in bytes).

assignMemSize

public void assignMemSize(int newMemSize)
Assigns a special amount of memory to this SweepArea. If this assignment causes a memory overflow, the handleOverflow-method is called.

Specified by:
assignMemSize in interface MemoryManageable
Parameters:
newMemSize - The amount of memory to be assigned to this SweepArea (in bytes).

insert

public void insert(E object)
Inserts an object into the underlying SweepArea and checks, wheather a memory overflow has occured or not. If an overflow has occured, the handleOverflow-method is called.

Specified by:
insert in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
insert in class DecoratorSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
object - The object to insert into the SweepArea.

handleOverflow

public abstract void handleOverflow()
This method is called, if an overflow has occured. Implementors of subclasses have to specify how to handle the overflow.
